newsitem.title: SPAIN: SOCCER-VALENCIA BOARD MAY DISCUSS MANAGER'S FUTURE.
newsitem.headline: SOCCER-VALENCIA BOARD MAY DISCUSS MANAGER'S FUTURE.

text.p: The future of beleaguered Valencia manager Luis Aragones is likely to be discussed at a special board meeting of the Spanish club on Tuesday.
Although Aragones was given a vote of confidence by Valencia chairman Paco Roig last week, his position has been weakened by clashes with Brazilian striker Romario and a string of mixed results.
Heading the list of candidates if a vacancy occurs is former Argentine World Cup midfielder Jorge Valdano, who lost his job as Real Madrid coach in January.
"Of course I want to coach. But to get in, somebody must first be let out," Valdano was quoted as saying by Monday's sports daily Marca.
